page.title: 06PUBS IN BOROUGH GREEN
page.content: The main road in Borough Green used to be a {toll road} and was part of the main route from London to Dover. Four of our five {pubs} are dotted along it, and three of them date back five hundred years. The Black Horse dates from 1594 and the Red Lion dates from 1586. The Rock was was a beer house between 1862 and 1872. It was a Friends' {Meeting House} before that. It became a full {pub} in 1950. The Railway Hotel was built just a year after the railway, in 1875, as more and more people came here by train. When people got off the train after long journeys they went in the Railway Hotel for a pint and some food. They could also stay the night there. (by T.Robinson,T.Ball,H.Dawes,A.Smith, S. Gorbould and J.Britton, all 10)
